data.title: Macwilliam to McBeath

Lancaster aircraft #PB 241 missing from a trip to Scholven/Buer, Germany. Three Canadians, F/O Beaune, FS Etheridge, and F/L Milligan were taken Prisoners of War. Three of the crew, not Canadians, missing... Read More
data.text:
MACWILLIAM, WALTER ALEXANDER P/O(AG) J92159//R250773. From MacGregor, Manitoba. Killed in Action Oct 6/44 age 24. #7 Squadron (Per Diem Per Noctum), Pathfinder Force. Lancaster aircraft #PB 241 missing from a trip to Scholven/Buer, Germany. Three Canadians, F/O Beaune, FS Etheridge, and F/L Milligan were taken Prisoners of War. Three of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Air Gunner MacWilliam is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MADDEN, JOSEPH LEO ANTHONY P/O(P) J861361/R115579. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed Feb 11/44 age 24. #410 Cougar Squadron (Noctivaga). Mosquito aircraft #HK 520 took off and gained an altitude of 200 feet and then crashed into the sea one mile from the pier on Bradwell Creek, Essex, England. WO R.T. Currie was also killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Madden is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MADDEN, LYNN BERTRAM F/L(P) J4555. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action May 15/43 age 22. #403 Wolf Squadron (Stalk And Strike). F/L Madden lost his life when his Spitfire aircraft #135 246 was shot down north-west of Poix-de-la-Somme during a fight with a German ME-109 fighter aircraft. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Madden is buried in the Churchyard at Poix-de-la-Somme, Somme, France.

MADDEN, WILLARD EUGENE P/O(P) J7032. From Dunbarton, Ontario. Killed Feb 23/42 age 23. #31 Service Flying Training School, Kingston, Ontario. Harvard aircraft #AJ 559 collided with Harvard #AJ 572, both aircraft went into a spin and crashed four miles west of Collins Bay, Ontario. P/O Madden and Fleet Air Arm airman ALA. W.H. Riddeft were killed in aircraft #AJ 559 and Fleet Air Arm airman ALA. C.A. Treble was killed in aircraft #AJ 572. Pilot Officer Pilot Madden is buried in the Erskine Cemetery at Dunbarton, Ontario.

MADDOCK, FREDERICK DANIEL FS(AG) R146775. From Oshawa, Ontario. Killed in Action May 25/44 age 21. #15 Squadron (Aim Sure). Lancaster aircraft #ND 955 was shot down over Holland during a night trip to Aachen, Germany. Six of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Maddock is buried in the Canadian Cemetery, Nijmegen, Holland.

MADEN, EARL KITCHENER FS(WAG) R135967. From Cornwall, Ontario. Killed Oct 30/43 age 20. #5 Operational Training Unit. Hudson aircraft #T 9352 missing during a night cross-country training flight. FS J.R. Baxter and two of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Maden has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MADGE, ROY GIBSON F/O(P) J13710. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action May 26/43 age 23. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft lost. Please see Pepper W.G. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Madge is buried in the War Cemetery, Heverlee, Brabant, Belgium.

MADIUK, ARTHUR LAC R198589 – drogue operator. From Thorsby, Alberta. Killed Jan 24/44 age 20. #2 Bombing and Gunnery School, Mossbank, Saskatchewan. A Bolingbroke aircraft and Lysander aircraft #2369 collided in mid-air two miles north-west of the #1 target after making a turn at the west end of Lake Johnston, Saskatchewan. The crews in the aircraft were participating in a routine gunnery exercise. The pilot of the Lysander, P/O W.R. Stephens, was also killed but there were no fatalities among the airmen in the Bolingbroke. Leading AirCraftman Madiuk is buried in the Ukranian Greek Catholic Cemetery at Thorsby, Alberta.

MADORE, GARFIELD ALEXANDER P/O(P) 42143 – Royal Air Force. From Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action May 23/40 age 22. #242 Squadron (Toujours Pret). P/O Madore was killed when his Hurricane aircraft was shot down whilst covering the evacuation from Dunkirk, France. Pilot Officer Pilot Madore is buried in the Anzac Cemetery, Sailly-Sur-la-Lup, France.

MADORE, PIERRE JOSEPH BENOIT MOREL P/O(N) J86422//R150678. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action Apr 27/44 age 22. #106 Squadron (Pro Libertate). Lancaster aircraft #JB 562 was shot down by flak south-east of Heidelberg between Eschelbronn and Meckesheim, Germany, during night operations to Schweinfurt, Germany. WO G. Bryson and three RAF crew members were also killed. Two of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Navigator Madore was buried in the Eschelbronn Cemetery, exhumed, and reinterred in the War Cemetery at Durnbach, Germany.

MADSON, JOHN EMMETT P/O(P) J8950. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Aug 20/42 age 20. #61 Squadron (Per Puram Tunantes). Lancaster aircraft crashed near Jornes, Spain. P/O T.L. Wilson, Sgts V.J. Watson (RAAF), H. Allen (RAF), T.L. Boland (RAF), R.H. Linton (RAF), and P/O J.H. Harrad (RAF) were also killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Madson was buried in a Churchyard in James, exhumed, and reinterred in the Bilbao British Cemetery, Lujua, Spain.

MAEDER, PAUL ALLEN CORNELL F/O(N) J43513//R224886. From Grimsby, Ontario. Killed Dec 18/44 age 20. #22 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see F/L W.F. Scott A.F.M. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Maeder is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MAFFRE, GERALD FREDERICK F/L(P) J10973. From Longueuil, Quebec. Killed in Action Apr 28/44 age 23. #434 Bluenose Squadron (In Excelsis Vincimus). BROTHER to Kenneth Reginald Maffre. Target – Montzen, Belgium. Please see P/O G.W. Snow C.G. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Maffre is buried in the General Cemetery at Mastricht, Holland.

MAFFRE, KENNETH REGINALD F/O(N) J7205. From Longueuil, Quebec. Killed in Action Feb 18/43 age 24. #415 Swordfish Squadron (Ad Metam). BROTHER to Gerald Frederick Maffre. Hampden aircraft crashed. Please see Vokey R.E. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Maffre is buried in the St. Mary Churchyard, Great Bircham, Bircham, Newton, Norfolk, England.

MAGDER, H1AM MURRAY FS(OB) R69500. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 2/43 age 21. #49 Squadron (Cave Canem). Lancaster aircraft crashed. Please see Dunand E.J. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Observer Magder was buried in the Military Cemetery at Venlo, Limburg, Holland, exhumed, and reinterred in the Jonkerbos British Cemetery, Nijmegen, Holland.

MAGEE, GERALD AUSTIN LAC(P) R154886 – under training. From Moncton, New Brunswick. Died Feb 1/43 age 23. #13 Elementary Flying Training School, St. Eugene, Ontario. Death by natural causes while in the Station Hospital at St. Eugene. Leading AirCraftman Pilot Magee is buried in the Elmwood Cemetery, Moncton, New Brunswick.

MAGEE, JAMES THOMAS JOSEPH P/O(N) J95544//R189744. From Verdun, Quebec. Killed in Action Mar 6/45 age 28. #576 Squadron (Carpe Diem). Lancaster aircraft #PD 403 was in a mid-air collision with another aircraft over the target Chemnitz, Germany. F/O C.J. Rouse, P/O R.W. Abrams, and FS W.W. Dewar were also killed. Three of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Navigator Magee has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAGEE, JOHN GILLESPIE P/O(P) J5823. From Washington, D.C., U.S.A. Killed Dec 11/41 age 19. #412 Falcon Squadron (Promtus Ad Vindictum). P/O Magee was killed when his Spitfire aircraft #AD 291 collided with an Oxford aircraft and crashed at Ruskington Hall, Ruskington, Lincolnshire. P/O Magee was born in Shanghai, China and was educated in Rugby, England and Avon, Connecticut, U.S.A., he is the author of the poem High Flight the original manuscript of which resides in the United States Library of Congress. Pilot Officer Pilot Magee is buried in the Scopwick Church Burial Ground, Scopwick, Lincolnshire, England.

MAGEE, THOMAS JOHN PAUL F/O(N) J21751//R186912. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed Jul 15/44 age 21. #172 Squadron. The crew of Wellington aircraft #NB 831 were on a night training flight when their aircraft crashed into the sea five miles west of Lundy Island. One crew member not Canadian was also killed. Four of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flying Officer Navigator Magee has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAGILL, JOHN GEORGE HENRY P/O(P) J86399//R136437. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action May 11/44 age 24. #11 Squadron (Octores Acrioresque Aquilis). P/O Magill made a crash landing after strafing enemy positions three miles north-east of Kohima, Assam. He was killed when his Hurricane aircraft #LD 185 overturned. Pilot Officer Pilot Magill was buried in the Military Cemetery at Dirnapur, Assam, exhumed, and reinterred in the Imphal Military Cemetery, Imphal, India.

MAGILL, THOMAS ELDON P/O(P) J85833//R130166. From Garson, Ontario. Killed in Action Jul 29/44 age 26. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Target – Hamburg, Germany. Please see Urquhart J.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Pilot Magill has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAGLADRY, HAROLD ERNEST FS(AG) R74322. From Ottawa, Ontario. Killed in Action Jul 2/42 age 24. #218 Gold Coast Squadron (In Time). The crew of Stirling aircraft #N 3718 took off on operations and were not heard from again. FSs R.F. Noton, R.J. Anderson, and three RAF crew members were also killed. Flight Sergeant Pilot Magladry has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England. Addendum: The RAF crew members also killed were FS R.E. Pithers, P/O G.G. Jeary, Sgts J. Mainwaring, and W.M. Watson. Detail provided by David E. Thompson, Middlesborough, England.

MAGNES, HAROLD JULIUS F/O(WAG) J26206. From Lockwood, Saskatchewan. Killed Nov 9/43 age 27. #23 Operational Training Unit, RAF Station, Wythall, England. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see Long C.R. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Magness is buried in the Pershore Cemetery, Worcestershire, England.

MAGNUSSON, CLARENCE NORRIS FS(P) R124246. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action May 22/43 age 27. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Sutton W.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Pilot Magnusson has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAGOFFIN, JAMES IVAN SGT(AG) R191611. From Lucknow, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 22/44 age 20. #207 Squadron (Semper Paratus). Target – Wesseling, Germany. Please see Somers B.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Magoffin is buried in the Communal Cemetery at Meeuwen, Limbourg, Belgium.

MAGONET, MANSON AC2(WAG) R174580 – under training. From Sydney, Nova Scotia. Died Sep 18/42 age 24. #5 Manning Depot. AC2 Magonet accidentally drowned at Lachine, Quebec. AirCraftman Second Class Wireless Operator Air Gunner Magonet is buried in the Hebrew Cemetery, Sydney, Nova Scotia.

MAGRATH, DOUGLAS ARTHUR F/O(P) J38058. From Roseland, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 14/45 age 21. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). Target – Chemnitz, Germany. Please see Robertson, Gordon E. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Magrath is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MAGSON, PHILIP JOHN ASHWORTH F/O(BA) J20912//R122231. From Quesnel, British Columbia. Killed in Action Aug 24/43 age 23. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus), Pathfinder Force. Target – Berlin, Germany. Please see S/L W.H. Baldwin D.F.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Bomb, Aimer Magson is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MAGUIRE, EDMUND HENRY DUGGAN SGT(BA) R148733. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed Feb 4/44 age 21. #82 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see Waldron W.R. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Bomb Aimer Maguire is buried in the 0llerton Cemetery, Nottinghamshire, England.

MAGUIRE, EDWARD STIDSTON F/L(P) J20939//R134131. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Feb 21/45 age 25. #432 Leaside Squadron (Saevitir Ad Lucem). Halifax aircraft #RG 451 missing from a night trip to Worms, Germany. F/O C.W. McMillan, P/O E.J. McClarty, F/Ls C.S. Moir, J.G. Maguire, and Sgt C.I. Grant (RAF) were also killed. One Canadian, FSs McLachlan, was either an Evader or was taken Prisoner of War. There were three #432 Sqdn. aircraft lost in the same area on this date. Please see P/O W.G. Mendenhall and P/O A.J. Hunter for information regarding the other crew and aircraft. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Maguire is buried in the War Cemetery at Rheinberg, Germany.

MAGUIRE, HUGH EDWARD F/L(WAG) J13396. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Aug 30/44 age 22. #524 Squadron. Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Watts C.R. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Lieutenant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Maguire is buried in the Protestant Cemetery, Oostvoorne, South Holland, Holland.

MAGUIRE, JAMES FS(WAG) R106115. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jan 23/43 age 22. #489 New Zealand Squadron. Hampden aircraft failed to return from an anti-shipping strike. FS A.G. Brown was also killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Maguire has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, Emgland.

MAGUIRE, JAMES FRANKISH F/L(OB) J4525. From Colonsay, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Sep 14/42 age 22. #37 Squadron (Wise Without Eyes). Wellington aircraft lost near Lagos, West Africa. Six RAF members of the crew, Sgts J.V. Glansfield, E.E. Lace, W/C. R.O.M. Graham D.F.C., FS W. Kelly, S/L J.A.H. Parker, and WO A.E. Turley D.F.M. were also killed. Flight Lieutenant Observer Maguire has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MAGUIRE, JOHN GOODWIN F/L(N) J20876//R147174. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Feb 21/45 age 24. #432 Leaside Squadron (Saevitir Ad Lucem). Target – Worms, Germany. Please see Maguire E.S. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Lieutenant Navigator Maguire is buried in the War Cemetery at Rheinberg, Germany.

MAGUIRE, LAWRENCE ROBERT P/O(P) J15100//R54228. From East Orange, New Jersey, U.S.A. Killed in Action Jul 15142. #8 Squadron (Uspiam Et Passim), Khormaksar, Aden. Blenheim aircraft was shot down near Jibuti, one RAAF and three RAF members of the crow were also killed. P/O Maguire had been slightly injured by enemy action on July 18, 1941 during operations with #21 Squadron. Pilot Officer Pilot Maguire was buried with full military honors in the New European Cemetery, Jibuti, French Somaliland.

MAGUIRE, PATRICK ERNEST LAC(P) R120050 – under training. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed Oct 7/42 age 22. #11 Service Flying Training School, Yorkton, Saskatchewan. LAC Maguire lost his life when his Cessna aircraft #8013 was in a mid-air collision during night flying training and crashed one half mile north of the aerodrome at Yorkton. There were no other casualties. Leading AirCraftman Pilot Maguire is buried in the Cote Des Neiges Cemetery, Montreal, Quebec.

MAHAGAN, WILFRED JOSEPH F/L(P) J11280. From Port Colborne, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 7/44 age 21. #440 Beaver Squadron. F/L Mahagan was killed when his Typhoon aircraft #MN 307 was hit by flak. The aircraft was seen to go down in flames and explode near the ground. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Mahagan is buried in the Old Churchyard at Noyers-Bocage, Calvados, France.

MAHER, ANTHONY JOSEPH SGT(P) R55815. From Valcartier Station, County of Portneuf, Quebec. Killed Feb 11/42 age 24. #9 Service Flying Training School, England. Miles Master aircraft #T 8404 and Tiger Moth aircraft #T 7850 collided and crashed on the Park Warcl/Shurdington Road, Cheltenham, England. P/O Jones (RNZAF), P/O Buckland (RAF), and F/O Pledger (RAF) were also killed. Sergeant Pilot Maher is buried in the Old Cemetery, Gloucester, Gloucestershire, England.

MAHER, GREGORY THOMAS P/O(P) C976. From North Bay, Ontario. Killed Nov 29/39 age 24. RCAF Station, Trenton, Ontario. Oxford aircraft crashed. Please see Stemple L.S. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Pilot Maher is buried in St. Mary’s Cemetery, North Bay, Ontario.

MAHER, JOSEPH FRANCIS SGT(AG) 798638 – Royal Air Force. From St. John’s, Newfoundland. Killed in Action Oct 4/42 age 22. #415 Swordfish Squadron (Ad Metam). Hampden aircraft failed to return from operations. P/O J.H. Barton (RAF) was also killed. Two others of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Sergeant Air Gunner Maher has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAHER, PETER JAMES FS(AG) R185430. From Bathurst, New Brunswick. Killed in Action Jan 20/44 age 20. #622 Squadron (Bellamus Noctu). Target – Berlin, Germany. Please see Fit.. D.A. Claydon for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Maher is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MAHEU, FRANCOIS GABRIEL WO2(AG) R55910. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jun 30/43 age 21. #425 Alouette Squadron (Je Te Plumerai). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Balderston J.P. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Air Gunner Maheu has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MAHLER, LAURENCE HERMAN F/O(N) J35749. From Preston, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 9/45 age 30. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus), Pathfinder Force. Target – Politz, Germany. Please see St. Pierre A.L. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Mahler has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAHON, MICHAEL STANLEY REECE P/O(N) J87637//R135064. From Barbados, British West Indies. Killed in Action Sep 21/44 age 28. #437 Husky Squadron (Omina Passim). The crew of Dakota aircraft #KG 376 were dropping supplies north-west of Arnhem, Holland when they were attacked and shot down by enemy fighter aircraft in the vicinity of Veghel, Holland. Pilot Officer Navigator Mahon has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAHONEY, JOHN AMBROSE P/O(WAG) J48161. From St. Leonards, New Brunswick. Killed Dec 2/44 age 19. #3 Operational Training Unit, Patricia Bay, British Columbia. Canso aircraft crashed. Please see F/L G. Ramsay M.i.D. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mahoney has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Ottawa War Memorial at Ottawa, Ontario.

MAHONEY, JOHN BURKE F/O(N) J22594. From Lachine, Quebec. Killed in Action Jan 21/44 age 27. #432 Leaside Squadron (Saevitir Ad Lucern). Target – Magdeburg, Germany. Please see Legace L.F. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Mahoney is buried in the Limmer British Cemetery at Hanover, Germany.

MAHR, RUDOLPH WALTER P/O(AG) J95545//R287922. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Mar 8/45 age 19. #101 Squadron (Mens Agitat Molem). Lancaster aircraft #PD 268 failed to return from a night trip to Dessau, Germany. Six members of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Mahr has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAIKA, PETER JOSEPH F/O(N) C13078. From Barry’s Bay, Ontario. Killed in Action Dec 30/44 age 27. #354 Squadron. Liberator aircraft #EV 942 failed to return from operations. F/L W.A. Manyluk was also killed. Flying Officer Navigator Maika has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MAILMAN, ARLINGTON WALTER CPL R88159 – equipment assistant. From Bridgewater, Nova Scotia. Died Jun 14/45 age 46. #5 R.M.B. Cpl. Mailman died in the RCAF Station Hospital at Dartmouth of injuries sustained in a motor vehicle accident. Corporal Mailman is buried in the Riverside Cemetery at Bridgewater, Nova Scotia.

MAIN, BASIL WILLIAM P/O(P) 10989411910904 – Royal Air Force. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Feb 4/42 age 22. #126 Squadron (Foremost In Attack). Hurricane aircraft failed to return from a sortie. Pilot Officer Pilot Main has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MAIN, FARIS CLYDE WO2(OB) R74704. From Eureka, California, U.S.A. Killed in Action Jun 26/42 age 21. #11 Operational Training Unit (Arm Well Aim Well). Wellington aircraft #R 1078 missing over enemy territory. One Canadian, P/O King, was either an Evader or was taken Prisoner of War. Three RNZAF crew members missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Observer Main is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MAIN, JOHN MCKINNON SGT(WAG) R60602. From Calgary, Alberta. Killed in Action Apr 24/43 age 22. #233 Squadron (Ymlaen). Hudson aircraft #FH 350 crashed in the sea forty miles east of Gibraltar. Sgt W.B. McCallum (RAF) and FS J.S. Mackie (RAAF) were also killed. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Main has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Gibraltar War Memorial, Gibraltar.

MAIN, LENNOX CAMERON P/O(AG) J18896//R114861. From Abbey, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Oct 3/43 age 23. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). Target – Kassel, Germany. Please see Crebbin G.J. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Main Was buried in the Enemy Nations Divison of the Military Section in the Cemetery at St. Vith, Belgium, exhumed, and reburied in the War Cemetery, Hatton, Luxembourg, Belgium.

MAIN, OWEN KEITH F/O(WAG) J20425. From Noel Shore, Hants County, Nova Scotia. Killed Sep 6/43 age 21. #415 Swordfish Squadron (Ad Metam). Hampden aircraft crashed and burned in the sea one quarter mile off Sand Head, Chichester, England. F/O R.E. Ritscher and FS H.J. Hanson were also killed. Flying Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Main is buried in the St. Nicholas Churchyard Extension, West Thorney, Thorney Island, Sussex, England.

MAIN, ROBERT LINDSAY AC2 R194809. From Nelson, British Columbia. Died Jun 11/43 age 22. #4 Initial Training School. AC2 Main died of natural causes in the University Hospital at Edmonton, Alberta. AirCraftman Second Class Main is buried in the Memorial Park, Nelson, British Columbia.

MAIN, THOMAS WO1 (WAG) R87882. From Victoria, British Columbia. Killed in Action Aug 13/43 age 22. #407 Demon Squadron (To Hold On High). Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see Tarver H.M. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class I Wireless Operator Air Gunner Main is buried in the St. Augustine Churchyard, Heanton Punchardon, Devonshire, England.

MAINGUY, RICHARD PATRICK F/L(OB) C6985. From Duncan, British Columbia. Killed May 10/42 age 26. #2 Wireless School, Calgary, Alberta. F/L Mainguy and the pilot, F/L A. Strugnell (RAF) were both killed when Fleet Fort aircraft #3585 stalled and struck the ground thirty-nine miles west of Calgary. Flight Lieutenant Observer Mainguy is buried in the Mount Calvary Roman Catholic Cemetery, Trenton, Ontario.

MAINPRIZE, HAROLD KESTER P/O(AG) J95352//R214453. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action N0v.6/44 age 20. #101 Squadron (Mons Agitat Molem). Target – Gelsenkirchen, Germany. Please see Leeds P. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Mainprize Was buried at Freidhof, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MAIR, ALEXANDER CAMPBELL W/C(P) C1635 D.F.C. From Windsor, Ontario. Killed in Action Nov 27/43 age 25. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Lancaster aircraft #DS 723 failed to return from night operations over Berlin, Germany. P/O8 G. Fielding (RAF), L.H. Matthews (RAF), and NO. W.R.E. North D.F.C. (RAF) were also killed. Three others of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Wing Commander Pilot Mair has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAIR, CHARLES MAXWELL F/O(N) J22694. From West Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Nov 25/43 age 23. #142 Squadron (Determination). Wellington aircraft #HE 99 missing from a raid on Turin, Italy. FSs S.J. Ouelette, G.P. Armstrong, and Sgt G. Bowering (RAF) were also killed. One other member of the crew, not Canadian, missing believed killed. Flying Officer Navigator Mair is buried in the Florence War Cemetery, Florence, Italy.

MAIR, JAMES IRVINE SGT(P) R92048. From Victoria, British Columbia. Killed Jun 16/42 age 19. #404 Buffalo Squadron (Ready To Fight). Blenheim aircraft #5765 flew into the ground during target practise at Tentsmuir Range, Leuchars, Scotland. Sgt D.W. Campbell, AC1 W.F. Dunbar (RAF), and one other RAF member of the crew were also killed. Sergeant Pilot Mair is buried in the Arbroath Eastern Cemetery, Arbroath and St. Vigeans, Angus, Scotland.

MAIR, JOHN OLAF F/O(AG) 78277 – Royal Air Force. From Victoria, British Columbia. Killed in Action Mar 22/41 age 33. #105 Squadron (Fortis In Proeliis). Blenheim aircraft lost during operations. Flying Officer Air Gunner Mair’s remains were cremated, his name is commemorated on a panel at the St. John’s Crematorium, Woking, Surrey, England.

MAISENBACHER, WILLIAM MALCOLM FS(AG) R137144. From Columbus, Ohio, U.S.A. Killed in Action Apr 4/43 age 27. #10 Squadron (Rem Acu Tangere). Halifax aircraft #HR 699 failed to return from operations. F/O J.A. Wann was also killed. Five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Maisenbacher has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAITLAND, WILLIAM JOHN F/L(P) J15405//R74901 D.F.M. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Dec 16/43 age 22. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Lancaster aircraft #LL 676 failed to return from a night raid on Berlin, Germany. F/O T. Gierulski, FSs C.A. Besse, R. Pettit, WO J.E. Saunders, Sgts T.I. Dee (RAF), K.R. Wood (RAF), and J.J. Robertson (RAF) were also killed. F/L Maitland had already completed one tour while flying Hampden aircraft with #420 Snowy Owl Squadron. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Maitland has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAJEAU, RUSSELL JOHN P/O(P) J15242 M.i.D. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action Apr 29/42. #407 Demon Squadron (To Hold On High). Hudson aircraft missing. Please see FS R. Hancock D.F.M. for casualty list and flight detail. P/O Majeau had flown twenty seven operations with this squadron prior to his death. Pilot Officer Pilot Majeau has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MAJOR, JAMES JOSEPH FS(OB) R88693. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed Aug 20/42 age 21. #296 Squadron. Whitley aircraft #BD 536 stalled and crashed during the landing approach at Leuchars. FS J.H. Kelly, AC2 R.F. Fisher (RAF), AC2 R.F.G. Padfield (RAF), and three other RAF members of the crew were also killed. Flight Sergeant Observer Major is buried in the Leuchars Cemetery, Fifeshire, Scotland.

MAJOR, THOMAS ERNEST F/O(P) J21628. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed Dec 21/43 age 24. #1679 Conversion Unit. Lancaster aircraft crashed. Please see F/O J.J. McGavok D.F.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Major is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate, Yorkshire, England.

MAKAY, ALBERT GEORGE WO2(P) R86164. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Oct 31/42 age 20. #150 Squadron (Aiei Anomem). Wellington aircraft missing since take-off. FS C.R. Patton, Sgt J.A. Fuller (RNZAF), and FO. W.A. Tolmie (RAF) were also killed. One other member of the crew, not Canadian, missing presumed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Pilot Makay is buried in the General Cemetery, at Willemsoord, Steenwijkerwold, Overijssel, Holland.

MAKEPEACE, THOMAS JOHNSON WO2(P) R157083. From Basswood, Manitoba. Killed in Action May 30/44. #148 Squadron (Trusty). Halifax aircraft missing. Please see McWilliams J.S. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Pilot Makepeace is buried in the Belgrade Military Cemetery, Belgrade, Yugoslavia.

MAKI, HARRY ARTHUR SGT(WAG) R220059. From Lockerby, Ontario. Killed Apr 25/44 age 18. #115 Bomber Reconnaissance Squadron (Beware), Tofino, British Columbia. Ventura aircraft crashed. Please see Robertson M.T. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Maki is buried in an isolated grave on the Summit of Mount Balduc, south of Honeymoon Bay, Lake Cowichan, British Columbia. His name is also inscribed on the Ottawa War Memorial, Ottawa, Ontario.

MAKSYMETZ, MAX RONALD AC2 R250959 – air frame mechanic. From Dauphin, Manitoba. Died Apr 22/43 age 19. #2 Initial Training School, Regina Saskatchewan. AC2 Maksymetz died of natural causes while in the RCAF Station Hospital at Regina. AirCraftman Second Class Maksymetz is buried in the Riverside Cemetery at Dauphin, Manitoba.

MALAIDACK, ALECK FS(AG) R252096. From Halifax, Nova Scotia. Killed Oct 25/44 age 21. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). Lancaster aircraft crashed. Please see P/O J.E. Schwerdfager for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Malaidack is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MALCOLM, DOUGLAS BURTON ST. JOHN SGT(WAG) R84388. From St. Catharines, Ontario. Killed Aug 4/42 age 21. #5 Operational Training Unit. Beaufort aircraft #L 4496 was on the landing approach when it flew into the ground one mile south of Turnberry, Scotland. Sgt F.J. Highmoor was also killed. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Malcolm is buried in the Dunure Cemetery, Ayrshire County, Scotland.

MALCOLM, KENNETH BRUCE F/O(AG) J17107. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 29/44 age 26. #429 Bison Squadron (Fortunae Nihil). Target – Berlin, Germany. Please see Siltala T. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Air Gunner Malcolm is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MALE, JOHN FREDERICK FS(P) R131168. From Hamilton, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 26/43 age 20. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Target – Gelsenkirchen, Germany. Please see Hunter J.D. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Pilot Male was buried in the Parish Cemetery at Holtwick, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MALES, CHARLES HARRY P/O(AG) J92952//R198424. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Oct 9/44 age 20. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Lancaster aircraft #KB 784 was hit by flak whilst on a trip to Bochum, Germany. P/O Males was killed by the flak and the aircraft returned safely to England with only the one casualty. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Males is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MALIN, JOHN ARNOLD SGT(P) R93845. From Camrose, Alberta. Killed Jul 9/41 ago 25. #5 Elementary Flying Training School, High River, Alberta. Sgt Malin and LAC J.W. Daly were both killed when Tiger Moth aircraft #4986 crashed in a large open field two miles north of Okotoks, Alberta. Sergeant Pilot Malin is buried in the Forest Home Cemetery, Ponoka, Alberta.

MALIN, KENNETH BRAWN FS(P) R142527. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed Jul 19/43 age 23. #61 Operational Training Unit. FS Malin lost his life when his Spitfire aircraft #P 7380 crashed at Aldersey, eight miles south-east of Chester, suspected engine trouble. Flight Sergeant Pilot Malin is buried in the Blacon Cemetery, Chester, Cheshire, England.

MALKEMUS, WILLIAM RISDON SGT(P) R72266. From Knoxville, Tennessee, U.S.A. Killed in Action Sep 7/41 age 20. #149 East India Squadron (Fortis Nocte). Stirling aircraft #X 9705 missing during bombing operations. Six of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Sergeant Pilot Malkemus is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MALLEN, WILLIAM BROWN F/O(N) J38216. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Feb 21/45 age 33. #76 Squadron (Resolute). Target – Worms, Germany. Please see Pennington J. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Mallen is buried in the War Cemetery at Rheinberg, Germany.

MALLETT, JOHN BURNS SGT(FE) R70158. From Palmerston, Ontario. Killed Mar 2/43 age 24. #57 Squadron (Corpus Non Animum Muto). Lancaster aircraft #R 5894 struck electric power cables and crashed three miles south of the aerodrome at Scampton. F/O J.F. Greenan, FS F.W. Music, and four of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Sergeant Flight Engineer Mallett is buried in St. John the Baptist Churchyard, Scampton, Lincolnshire, England.

MALLETT, RONALD FREDERICK F/O(N) J11451//R110857. From Elkhorn, Manitoba. Killed in Action Nov 30/42 age 23. #22 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see FS V. Meanwell for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Mallett is buried in the Stratford-On-Avon Cemetery, Evesham Road, Warwickshire, England.

MALLETTE, JOSEPH RAOUL HENRI BERNARD CLOVIS P/O(BA) J89459//R154165. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action May 23/44 age 25. #425 Alouette Squadron (Je Te Plumerai). Target – Le Mans, France. Please see Laporte E.E. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Bomb Aimer Mallette is buried in West Cemetery, Le Mans, Sarthe, France.

MALLORY, GORDON EWART F/O(P) C16622. From Port Alberni, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jun 13/44 age 22. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Target – Cambrai, France. Please see Stewart G.E. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Mallory is buried in the Military Cemetery, Forenville, Nord, France.

MALLORY, HERBERT DAVID WO2(P) R113624. From Woodstock, New Brunswick. Killed Apr 30/44 age 22. #434 Bluenose Squadron (In Excelsis Vincimus). Halifax aircraft missing during an attack on Nuremberg, Germany on August 28, 1943. Please see ThouId T.F. for casualty list and flight detail. WO Mallory was taken Prisoner of War and was killed by an enemy JU-88 aircraft when he was in the exercise yard at P.O.W. Camp IVB. Bob Stewart of Roland, Manitoba and Bud Ward of Edmonton, Alberta saw the JU-88 come up from behind Mallory, hit him, and then saw the enemy aircraft strike the fence on the way out. Warrant Officer Class II Pilot Mallory is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MALLORY, LESLIE ALLAN WO2(AG) R94772. From Shaunavon, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Aug 24/43 age 33. #78 Squadron (Nemo Non Paratus). Halifax aircraft #JD 310 was shot down at KlosterteIde, Germany during operations over Berlin, Germany. P/O J.G. Castle was also killed. Five members of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Air Gunner Malory was buried at Klosterfelde, exhumed, and reburied in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MALLOY, JOHN ALFRED PL(P) J11008//R111299. From Ottawa, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 13/45 age 23. #274 Squadron (Supero). F/L Malloy was engaged in an armed reconnaissance to Paderborn, Germany and failed to pull up after strafing a car. He was killed when his Tempest aircraft #EJ 639 crashed twenty miles south-west of Munster, Germany. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Malloy is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MALMAS, HAROLD IRVIN F/L(N) J17391. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action May 31/45 age 25. #407 Demon Squadron (To Hold On High). The crew of Wellington aircraft #NC 512 were returning from an anti-sub patrol over the Bay of Biscay when they crashed in the sea off Sharp Nose Point, North Devon, England. F/L W.M. Bowlen, P/O G.D. Bowes, F/Os R.K. McGrath, U. Eisler, and J.E. Garrigan were also killed. Flight Lieutenant Navigator Malmas is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MALOFIE, DANIEL P/O(N) J8596. From Fisher Branch, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jul 3/42 age 31. #214 Federated Malay States Squadron (Ultor In Umbria). Stirling aircraft #BE 313 missing during a night trip over enemy-held territory. Sgts E.G. Wilson, R. Fairhurst (RAF), P.F. Inman (RAF), J.W.C. Underwood (RAF), T.E.L. Palmer (RAF), W/C. K.D. Knocker (RAF), and FS R.H. Ritchie (RAF) were also killed. There were two pilots on board for this operation. Pilot Officer Navigator Malofie is buried in the General Cemetery at Westernieland, Eenrum, Gronigen, Holland.

MALONE, BERNARD EDWARD LAC R122983. From Kirkland Lake, Ontario. Killed Oct 26/42 age 22. RAF Ferry Command, Detachment F., Goose Bay, Labrador. Ventura aircraft crashed. Please see Peeble V.F. for casualty list and flight detail. Leading AirCraftnnan Malone is buried in the Kirkland Cemetery, Kirkland Lake, Ontario.

MALONE, EDWARD CECIL WO2(WAG) R86225. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Dec 20/42 age 22. #78 Squadron (Nemo Non Paratus). Halifax aircraft ditched. Please see Hunter J.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Wireless Operator Air Gunner Malone has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MALONEY, THOMAS JOSEPH P/O(WAG) J936881/R188962. From Marmora, Ontario. Killed in Action Dec 29/44 age 21. #419 Moose Squadron (Moosa Aswayita). Target – Scholven/Buer, Germany. Please see Sorrenti V.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Maloney was buried at Gelsenkirchen/Buer, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswa/d Forest War Cemetry, Kleve, Germany.

MALONEY, WILLIAM PATRICK F/O(P) J29566//R184199 D.F.C. From Sudbury, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 21/45 age 21. #625 Squadron (We Avenge). Lancaster aircraft #NG 267 blew up over Germany during a night trip to Dortmund, Germany. P/O G.H. Shephard, B.S. Thompson, WO J.A. Dickson, FS 0. Harding, and F/O H.R. Dart were also killed. One of the crew, not Canadian, missing believed killed. Flying Officer Pilot Maloney is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MALTAS, FRANCES GILES P/O(AG) J90373//R187224. From Hazeldine, Alberta. Killed in Action Jul 19/44 age 26. #50 Squadron (From Defence To Attack). Lancaster aircraft #DV 312 crashed seventeen miles from Montdidier, at Robert-Magny, France during night operations to Revigny, France. F/O W.J. Long, P/O T.H. Lunnin, Sgts W.H. Latham (RAF), R.E. Thomas (RAF), and M. Whiteley (RAF) were also killed. One Canadian, F/O Desautels, was taken Prisoner of War. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Maltais is buried in the Churchyard at Robert Magny, Haute-Marne, France.

MALTBY, WILLIAM THOMAS P/O(AG) J93797//R261743. From Kamloops, British Columbia. Killed in Action Mar 4/45 age 19. #76 Squadron (Resolute). The crew of Halifax aircraft #NA 584 returned from operations over Kamen, Germany and were flying at 2,500 feet when they were shot up by an enemy night fighter aircraft while in the landing circuit at HoIme on Moor, Yorkshire. The Halifax swung off the runway, due to the port tire being punctured, and collided with a parked aircraft and a steam roller. P/O Maltby was the only member of the crew hit by the night fighter and was the only casualty. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Maltby is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate, Yorkshire, England.

MALTON, GEORGE SAMUEL F/O(P) J9684. From Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Mar 28/43 age 22. #610 County of Chester Squadron (Alifero Tollitur Axe Ceres). Spitfire aircraft #EE 739 missing in the sea north of Fecamp, France, enemy action. Flying Officer Pilot MaIton has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MALUISH, GEORGE DOUGLAS FS(AG) R68700. From Kenora, Ontario. Killed Jul 7/42 age 21. #21 Squadron (Viribus Vincimus). Blenheim aircraft #V 5851 crashed three miles south of Watton at Stowbedon, Norfolk. FS F.B. Heron and Sgt G.E. Step (RAF) were also killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Maluish is buried in the St. Mary Churchyard, Watton, Norfolk, England.

MALYON, DOUGLAS FRANCIS P/O(BA) J89865//R179628. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Apr 23/44 age 22. #12 Squadron (Leads The Field). Lancaster aircraft #ND 715 missing during a night operation against Dusseldorf, Germany, FSs F.W. Barnett (RAF), R.V. Donowa (RAAF), Sgts R.S. Smith (RAF), and C.H. Thompson (RAF) were also killed. Two of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Bomb Aimer Malyon is buried in the Schoonselhof Cemetery, Antwerp, Wilrijk, Belgium.

MALYON, WILLIAM JOHN P/O(WAG) J93612//R251974. From Cornwall, Ontario. Killed in Action Mar 16/45 age 20. #12 Squadron (Leads The Field). Target – Nuremberg, Germany. Please see PL. K.W. Daymond for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Malyon is buried in the War Cemetery at Durnbach, Germany.

MALZAN, ALBERT PAUL WO2(N) 750. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed Apr 10/44 age 30. #1 Radio School, Madley, England. Lancaster aircraft #JB 471 caught fire in mid-air and crashed at Llanwrtyd WeIs, Breconshire, Wales. FS G.J. Shields and six of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Warrant Officer Class II Navigator Malzan is buried in the Haycombe Cemetery, Bath, Englishcombe, Somerset, England.

MANAHAN, JAMES ROSS S/L(P) 41443 D.F.C. – Royal Air Force. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jun 12/43 age 26. #100 Squadron (Sarang Tebaun Jangan Duolok). Lancaster aircraft failed to return from operations. Six of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. S/L Manahan flew 42 ops. with #148 Sqdn. in 1941 flying Wellington aircraft over North Africa, Greece, Crete, and Malta. Squadron Leader Pilot Manahan has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANATON, ALBERT CHARLES P/O(P) 41600 – Royal Air Force. From Moncton, New Brunswick. Killed in Action Mar 12/40 age 19. #61 Squadron (Per Puram Tunantes). Hampden aircraft lost over England. Pilot Officer Pilot Manaton is buried at Helmswell, Lincolnshire, England.

MANCHIP, FRANCIS WALTER P/O(AG) J89367//R114328. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Nov 30/44 age 24. #429 Bison Squadron (Fortunae Nihil). Target – Duisburg, Germany. Please see Short C.W. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Manchip was buried in the British Burial Ground at Weerk, Holland, exhumed, and reburied in the Canadian Cemetery, Nijmegen, Holland.

MANCHUL, DONALD PETER P/O(AG) J94826//R202910. From Fort Chippewan, Alberta. Killed in Action Jul 21/44 age 20. #514 Squadron (Nil Obstare Potest). Lancaster aircraft #HK 570 failed to return from night operations over Homberg, Germany. P/O B.H. Cooper was also killed. Five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Manchu’ has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANCHUR, CARL ALBERT FS(AG) R80326. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jul 29/42 age 21. #12 Squadron (Leads The Field). Wellington aircraft stalled and crashed immediately after taking off on operations from the Binbrook aerodrome, England. The aircraft caught fire and the bomb load exploded. P/O M.H. James (RAF), Sgts W. Foster (RAF), J.W. Ross (RAF), and C.F. Stephens (RAF) were also killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Manchur is buried in the St. Mary Churchyard, Binbrook, Lincolnshire, England.

MANDER, WILLIAM ERIC FS(WAG) R56422. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jul 27/42 age 22. #102 Ceylon Squadron (Tentate Et Perficite). Halifax aircraft lost over Holland, presumed enemy action. FS J.K. Baker and F/O W.J.J. Hitchcock (RAF) were also killed. Four other RAF members of the crew missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mander is buried in the General Cemetery at Delfzijl, Groningen, Holland.

MANDERS, CLARENCE DELROSE FS(AG) R124412. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Nov 24/43 age 20. #426 Thunderbird Squadron (On Wings of Fire). Target – Berlin, Germany. Please see Huffman G.L. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Manders is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate, England.

MANDERS, ROBERT EMMETT P/O(OB) J5084. From Shanghai, China. Killed in Action Mar 17/42 age 22. #49 Squadron (Cave Canem). P/O5 Manders and Cook (RAF) were both killed when Hampden aircraft #P 1226 flew into a cliff, in bad visibilty, near Branscombe at Birry Farm, Devon. Pilot Officer Observer Manders is buried in the Higher Cemetery, Heavitree, Exeter, Devonshire, England.

MANDIN, EMILE FRANCOIS BRUNO FS(OB) R75471. From Duck Lake, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Jun 9/42 age 26. #150 Squadron (Aiei Anomen). Wellingon aircraft #X 3725 missing since take-off. One RAAF and three RAF members of the crew were also killed. Flight Sergeant Observer Mandin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANFIELD, JACK STANNAS SGT R50969 – fire fighter. From Edmonton, Alberta. Died Dec 28/43 age 33. #3 Operational Training Unit, Patricia Bay, British Columbia. Death by natural causes while in the Shaughnessy Hospital, Vancouver, British Columbia. Sergeant Manfield is buried in the Beechmount Cemetery at Edmonton, Alberta.

MANG, RONALD FRANZ P/O(P) J17769. From Cut Knife, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Jul 13/43 age 21. #424 Tiger Squadron (Castigandos Castigarnus). Wellington aircraft #HE 963 failed to return from operations. F/O W.C. Davidson, WO RE. Vanderbeck, FS D. Campbell (RAF), and Sgt J.P.M. Garland (RAF) were also killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Mang has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MANGAN, JOHN THOMAS FS(WAG) R69117. From North Bay, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 7/43 age 23. #5 Bomber Reconnaissance Squadron (Volando Vincimus), Gander, Newfoundland. Canso aircraft crashed. Please see S/L N.E. Small D.F.C., A.F.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Mangan is buried in the Gander Cemetery, Gander, Newfoundland.

MANK, MATTHEW P/O(P) J16626. From Miami, Florida, U.S.A. Killed in Action Apr 15/43 age 21. #7 Squadron (Per Diem Per Noctum), Pathfinder Force. Stirling aircraft #BK 709 missing during a night trip over enemy territory, presumed enemy action. WOs H.E. Budd, H.D. Oke, J.T. Roy, and three RAF members of the crew were also killed. There were two #7 Sqdn. aircraft lost in the same area on this date. Please see WO L.W. Bartman for information regarding the other aircraft and a list of non-Canadians killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Mank is buried in the War Cemetery at Durnbach, Germany.

MANLEY, DOUGLAS RUSSELL F/O(P) J9358. From Wetaskiwin, Alberta. Killed in Action Nov 8/42 age 20. #401 Ram Squadron (Mors Celerrirna Hostibus). Spitfire aircraft was escorting bomber aircraft when it was shot down ten miles south-west of Gravelines, France. F/L D. Morrison and F/O Manley were chasing two FW-190 enemy aircraft when four FW-190 aircraft jumped them. Morrison was shot down and taken Prisoner of War. Manley’s aircraft was damaged and he was flying near the French Coast with his wheels down when he was hit by flak and crashed into a house. Flying Officer Pilot Manley is buried in the War Cemetery at Pihen-les-Guines War Cemetery, Pas-de-Calais, France.

MANN, DOUGLAS SGT(WAG) R79067. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jan 9/43 age 21. #158 Squadron (Strength In Unity). Halifax aircraft #W 7751 took off on operations and was never heard from again. Sgts J.E. Lavigne, H.I. Goodwill (RAF), P.F.E. Newman (RAF), and FS R. Owen (RAF) were also killed. Two of the crew, not Canadians, missing presumed killed. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mann is buried in the Fourfelt Cemetery, Esbjerg, Jutland, Denmark.

MANN, EDWARD JAMES F/O(P) J85595 D.F.C. From Regina, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Jul 29/44 age 20. #576 Squadron (Carpe Diem). Lancaster aircraft #LL 905 was shot down by an enemy night fighter aircraft six miles south-east of Saaralben, Alsace Lorraine near Saarewerden during a night raid against Stuttgart, Germany. FS D.I. MacVicar and Sgt R.A.W. Roberts (RAF) were also killed. One Canadian, F/O Novak, was taken Prisoner of War and three of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. There were two #576 Sqdn. aircraft lost this same date. Please see F/O R.S. McGibbon for information regarding the other aircraft and crew. Flying Officer Pilot Mann is buried in the Communal Cemetery, Saarewerden, Bas-Rhin, France.

MANN, JOEL BROOKS JR. F/O(P) J13317. From Dowagiac, Michigan, U.S.A. Killed in Action Jun 27/43 age 21. #143 Squadron (Vincere Est Vivere). Beaufighter aircraft #JL 942 lost to enemy action during operations. The navigator, not Canadian, missing believed killed. Flying Officer Pilot Mann has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANN, LLOYD ROBERTSON F/O(WAG) J15638 D.F.C. From Truro, Nova Scotia. Killed in Action Dec 21/42 age 23. #156 Squadron (We Light The Way), Pathfinder Force. Wellington aircraft lost. Please see F/L S.J. Cybulski D.F.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mann is buried in the Churchyard at Matignicourt-Et-Goncourt, Marne, France.

MANN, MARGARET LAW W302037. From North Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed Jul 13/45. #11 Bomber Reconnaissance Squadron, Patricia Bay, British Columbia. Liberator aircraft #11121 was on a routine trip with passengers when it crashed and burned near Barkley Sound, British Columbia. Members of the crew; F/Os R.J. Martell, W.E. Davies, N.M. Popovitch, H.A. Lowe, WOs V.G. Crosson, J.B. Presse, FS D.W. Hope, and passengers; LACs L.H. Tull, R.V. Kitely, Cpl.s Nora Johnson, Norman Johnson, W. Hrysko, and Sgt P.G. Bennett were also killed. Cpl. Nora Johnson and Cpl. Norman Johnson were sister and brother. Leading AirWoman Mann is buried in an isolated grave on the south-west shore of Barkely Sound, fifteen miles south-east of Bamfield, British Columbia. Her name is also inscribed on the Ottawa War Memorial, Ottawa, Ontario.

MANN, RONALD PERCY SGT(AG) R61354. From North Portal, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Nov 30/41 age 19. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducirnus). Target – Hamburg, Germany. Please see S/L R.C. Bisset D.F.C. & Bar for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Mann has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANN, STANLEY DICKINSON F/O(N) J38736. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed Jul 16/44 age 28. #30 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft #NC 678 caught fire, during a bombing practise, and crashed near Stafford at North Huntingdon, England. Sgt P.H. Mullins, FS J.H. Jones, and one of the crew, not Canadian, were also killed. Flying Officer Navigator Mann is buried in the Blacon Cemetery, Chester, Cheshire, England.

MANN, WALTER EDWARD FS(P) R107981. From Regina, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action May 13/43 age 20. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Lundy E.E. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Pilot Mann is buried in the Dieppe Canadian War Cemetery, Hautot-sur-Mer, France.

MANN, WILLIAM GEORGE P/O(WAG) J92138//R191926. From London, Ontario. Killed in Action Oct 15/44 age 19. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). Target – Wilhelmshaven, Germany. Please see Sanders W.H. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mann was buried at Westerhever, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Kiel War Cemetery, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany.

MANNERS, FRANK THORBURN F/O(N) J14239. From Squamish, British Columbia. Killed in Action Sep 27/43 age 23. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Halifax aircraft #JB 968 was shot down by an enemy night fighter aircraft near the potassium pit at Kalischacht, south of Ronneberg, seven miles south-west of the target Hanover, Germany. Fit. R.H. Sherback, F/O E.D. MacMurchy, Sgts D.W. Matthews, D.B. Stone, W.E. McKee, and one RAF member of the crew were also killed. There were two #428 Sqdn. aircraft lost in the same area on this date. Please see F/O C.M. Butcher for information regarding the other aircraft, the crew, and a list of the non Canadian casualties. Flying Officer Navigator Manners was buried in the Ronneberg Cemetery, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Limmer British Cemetery at Hanover, Germany.

MANNETT, CLARENCE WILFRED F/O(N) J36705. From Halifax, Nova Scotia. Killed Dec 18/43 age 23. #11 Bomber Reconnaissance Squadron, Torbay, Newfoundland. Hudson aircraft crashed. Please see Weir G.E. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Navigator Mannett is buried in the Gander Cemetery, Gander, Newfoundland.

MANNING, FREDERICK JOHN F/O(P) J44304//R172378. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Mar 28/45 age 34. #692 Squadron (Polus Dum Sidera Pascet). Mosquito aircraft #PF 466 failed to return from a night operation over Berlin, Germany. The RAF navigator was also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Manning has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANNING, GORDON HARRY LAC R84990. From Sussex, New Brunswick. Died Oct 15/41 age 18. #5 Initial Training School, Belleville, Ontario. LAC Manning was on leave when he was killed in a motor accident at Moncton, New Brunswick. Leading AirCraftman Manning is buried in the Kirk Hill Cemetery, Sussex, New Brunswick.

MANNING, JACK WO2(WAG) R159433. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action Jul 5/44 age 21. #31 Squadron (In Caelum Indicum Primus). Dakota aircraft #FZ 585 failed to return from dropping supplies to the British 14th Army. WO J. Bicknell was also killed. Warrant Officer Class II Wireless Operator Air Gunner Manning has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MANNING, PERCIVAL THEODORE SGT(WAG) R59283. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed Jul 22/41 ago 20. #11 Operational Training Unit (Arm Well Aim Well). The crew of Wellington aircraft #R 1334 were engaged in night flying training, flying from Ashwell to Baldock to Hertfordshire, England, when they were shot down. Sgts F.S. Houston, R.A. McAllister (RAAF), and B.C. Thompson (RAAF) were also killed. Ex S/L James C. Lovelace D.F.C. of Sydney, Nova Scotia had this to say, “A Wellington aircraft, captured by the enemy, joined the circuit and shot this aircraft down.” S/L Lovelace had completed three tours in 1942-1942 and was in Bournemouth sending Canadian airmen to their many postings during 1943-1944. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Manning is buried in the Bassingbourn and Kneesworth Cemetery, Basingbourn, Cambridgeshire, England.

MANSELL, LLOYD COLLEY SGT(OB) R51633. From Hamilton, Ontario. Killed in Action Aug 30/41 age 32. #42 Squadron (Fortiter In Re). Sgt Mansell was killed when his Beaufort aircraft #L 9834 crashed at Craigfootie, Fife. Sergeant Observer Mansell is buried in the Leuchars Cemetery, Fifeshire, Scotland.

MANSER, RAYMOND EARL FS(WAG) R115267. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed May 26/43 age 21. #180 Squadron (Sauviter In Modo Fortiter In Re). Mitchell aircraft #FL 696 failed to return from a training flight over the sea. F/O H.M. Wygle and FS C.G. Kernaghan were also killed. One of the crew, not Canadian, missing presumed killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Manser is buried in St. Mary Churchyard, Great Bircham, Bircham, Norfolk, England.

MANSER, WILLIAM MASON MAXWELL P/O(BA) J18903. From Woodstock, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 15/44 age 24. #102 Ceylon Squadron (Tentate Et Perficite). Halifax aircraft #HX 155 failed to return from night operations over Berlin, Germany. F/O J.M. Filmer was also killed. Six of the crew, not Canadians, missing presumed killed. Pilot Officer Bomb Aimer Manser has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANSFIELD, RICHARD GERARD F/O(P) J85770 D.F.C. From Ottawa, Ontario. Killed Nov 24/44 age 27. #419 Moose Squadron (Moosa Aswayita). The crew of Lancaster aircraft #KB 875 were returning from a cross-country flight when the aircraft caught fire in midair and crashed near the bombing range at Bradbury, Durham County, England. F/O A.C. Hirst, P/O G.H. Warren-Darley, FSs L.W. Toth, D.A. Gunn, J.J. Murphy, and P/O D.G. Newland (RAF) were also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Mansfield is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Weatherby Road, Harrogate, Yorkshire, England. Addendum: On 19 June 1994 a special plaque was dedicated and a maple tree was planted as a memorial to the crew of KB 875. The plaque was sited on the church wall adjoining the village memorial. This took place in the village of Sedgefield and the service was conducted at the St. Edmund’s Parish Church. The Roll of Honour on the plaque reads: On 24th November 1944, the crew of a Lancaster Bomber of number 419 Moose Squadron, Royal Canadian Air Force, Middleton St. George, paid the SUPREME SACRIFICE. This plaque is dedicated to those who lost their lives – P/O Richard Mansfield DFC Ottawa, Canada; FS Douglas Ginn Toronto, Canada; FS George Warren-Dailey Toronto, Canada; F/O Allan Hirst Vancouver, Canada; FS John Murphy Detroit, USA; FS Leslie Toth Kipling, Canada; Sgt Derrick Newland London, England. LEST WE FORGET. Detail provided by David E. Thompson, Middlesborough, England.

MANSON, DONALD HENDRY P/O(P) J85487. From Brandon, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jul 6/44 age 26. #582 Squadron (Pre Volamus Designantes), Pathfinder Force. Target – Wizernes, France. Please see Salomaa E.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Pilot Manson has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANSON, HAROLD JOHN CPL R59172 – air frame mechanic. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Died Aug 26/42 age 29. #3 Service Flying Training School, Calgary, Alberta. Cpl. Manson lost his life in an off duty auto accident in Calgary. Corporal Manson is buried in the Elmwood Cemetery at Winnipeg, Manitoba.

MANSON, HAROLD MAGNUS SGT(WAG) R192989. From Burnaby, British Columbia. Killed May 29/44 age 20. #5 Operational Training Unit, Boundary Bay, British Columbia. Mitchell aircraft crashed. Please see Johnston C.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Manson is buried in an inaccessible grave on Vancouver Island, British Columbia at 48- 56N Latitude and 124 – 11W Longitude. His name is also inscribed on the Ottawa War Memorial at Ottawa, Ontario.

MANSON, JOHN GEORGE P/O(AG) J89864//R181949. From Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Apr 18/44 age 21. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Halifax aircraft #JN 973 failed to return from a night-mine laying operation in the harbour at Kiel, Germany. P/Os G.W. Lillico, W.K. Johnson, T. Zbytnuik, F/O J.M. Westlake, and FS W.J. Olmstead were also killed. One of the crew, not Canadian, missing presumed killed. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Manson has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MANSON, WILLIAM MACKENZIE FS(OB) R 112619. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Apr 29/43 age 23. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Smith-Jones H.V. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Observer Manson was buried at Wangerooge, Frisian Islands, exhumed, and reburied in the Sage War Cemetery, Oldenburg, Land Niedersachsen, Germany.

MANTHA, RENE REAL SGT(AG) R151473. From North Bay, Ontario. Killed in Action May 28/43 age 19. #158 Squadron (Strength In Unity). Halifax aircraft lost. Please see Wyatt W.H. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Mantha is buried in the General Cemetery, Raalte, Overijssel, Holland.

MANUEL, GERALD FENWICK SGT(P) R69888, From Halifax, Nova Scotia. Killed Jul 7/41 age 25. #53 Operational Training Unit. Two Spitfire aircraft collided in mid-air over Merthyr Vale, Wales. Sergeant Pilot Manuel is buried in the Merthyr Tydfil (Ffrwd) Cemetery, Penderyn, Glamorganshire, Wales.

MANWELL, ROBERT GORDON P/O(AG) J92365//R260154. From Portage du Fort, Quebec. Killed in Action Oct 14/44 age 19. #419 Moose Squadron (Moosa Aswayita). Target – Duisburg, Germany. Please see Sigal H. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Manwell was buried in the Waldfriedhof Forest Cemetery, Lohmannsheide, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MANYLUK, WILLIAM ALEXANDER F/L(P) J22965//R105677. From Vermillion, Alberta. Killed in Action Dec 30/44 age 22. #354 Squadron. Liberator aircraft #EV 942 failed to return from operations. F/O P.J. Maika was also killed. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Manyluk has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MARA, JOSEPH FREDERICK FS(AG) R203234. From Brampton, Ontario. Killed in Action Jul 19/44 age 20. #619 Squadron. Target – Revigny, France. Please see Wilson H.J. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Mara is buried in the Communal Cemetery at Villers St. Genest, Oise, France.

MARA, NEIL DUNCAN F/L(P) J16120//R72059 D.F.C. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Feb 4/45 age 24. #433 Porcupine Squadron (Qui S’y Frotte S’y Pique). BROTHER to Stanley Mara. Lancaster aircraft #PA 219 was in a mid-air collision and then crashed in a field five miles south of Vielsalm, near Courtil, Belgium during a night raid against Bonn, Germany. P/Os B.T. Sheeran, N.A. Hurst, F/Os W.L. Melbourne, C.H. Howald, A.J. Tyrell, and W.G. Whitton also killed. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Mara was buried at the crash site, exhumed, and reburied in the War Cemetery, Hotton, Luxembourg, Belgium.

MARA, STANLEY FS(AG) R212967. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Oct 15/44 age 20. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). BROTHER to Neil Duncan Mara. Target – Wilhemshaven, Germany. Please see Sanders W.H. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Mara is buried at Wilhelmshaven, Germany. His name is also inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARANDA, JOSEPH CYRIL ROBERT P/O(P) J89808//R141592. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jun 8/44. #416 City of Oshawa Squadron (Ad Soltum Paratus). P/O Maranda was forced to bail out of his Spitfire aircraft #MJ 929 when it was hit by flak. He was seen to land in the water at the mouth of the Seine River, France. Pilot Officer Pilot Maranda has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARCELLUS, DOUGLAS LLOYD P/O(AG) J95393//R254554. From Chesterville, Ontario. Killed in Action Dec 7/44 age 19. #419 Moose Squadron (Moosa Aswayita). BROTHER to Francis Simon Marcellus. Target – Osnabruck, Germany. Please see Smith G. Edward for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Marcellus has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARCELLUS, FRANCIS SIMON P/O(WAG) J90146//R135741. From Chesterville, Ontario. Killed Jul 14/44 age 26. #77 Squadron (Esse Potius Quam Videri). BROTHER to Douglas Lloyd Marcellus. Halifax aircraft crashed. Please see Smirl G.A. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marcellus is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate Yorkshire, England.

MARCH, GILBERT HORACE F/O(BA) J38289. From Thormdale, Ontario. Killed in Action Dec 18/44 age 23. #432 Leaside Squadron (Saevitir Ad Lucem). Halifax aircraft #G 701 missing during a daylight op. an attack against Duisburg, Germany. P/Os E.J. Farrell, E.P. Harvey, F/O D. Hitchcock, and P/O M.J. Boylan (RAF) were also killed. Two others of the crew, not Canadian, missing believed killed. There were two #432 Sqdn. aircraft lost on this date. Please see Cann, R.L. for information regarding the other crew and aircraft. Flying Officer Bomb Aimer March was buried at Chalons sur Marne, France, exhumed, and reburied in the Dieppe Canadian War Cemetery, Hautotsur-Mer, France.

MARCHAND, JOSEPH ERIC RITCHIE FS(WAG) R96762. From Three Rivers, Quebec. Killed in Action Jun 11/43 age 25. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see Jette J.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marchand is buried in the West Cemetery, Darlington, Durham, England.

MARCHANT, JAMES EARL FS(AG) R61972. From Clair, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Dec 4/43 age 22. #97 Squadron (Achieve Your Aim), Pathfinder Force. BROTHER to John Philip Marchant. Lancaster aircraft #JB 232 failed to return from a raid on Leipzig, Germany. Six of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Marchant has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARCHANT, JOHN PHILIP F/O(WAG) J85813//R87101. From Clair, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Mar 25/45 age 26. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). BROTHER to.slames Earl Marchant. Target – Munster, Germany. Please see Shantz F.W. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marchant is buried in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MARCHANT, ROBERT CRESWELL FS(WAG) R92040. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jun 25/42 age 22. #20 Operational Training Unit (Train To Triumph). Wellington aircraft lost to enemy action. Sgt H.H. Hudson (RAF), FS J. Storey (RAF), and F/O J.B. Munro (RNZAF) were also killed. Two Canadians, Sgts Levasseur and Thomson, were taken Prisoners of War. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marchant is buried in the Terschelling General Cemetery, Frisian Islands, Friesland, Holland.

MARCHESSAULT, JOSEPH JEAN MARIE PAUL FS(BA) R164704. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed Oct 17/43 age 31. #23 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see WO George Smith for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Bomb Aimer Marchessault is buried in the Haycombe Cemetery, Bath, Englishcombe, Somerset, England.

MARCHINGTON, GEORGE FREDERICK SGT(BA) R193537. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed Jun 27/44 age 21. #18 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft #Z 1592 crashed at the Baner Farm, Middle Rasen, Lincolnshire, England. Sgts G.K. Cameron, E.A. Crowe, G.H. Durham, RS. Cracknell, and E. Bunt were also killed. Sergeant Bomb Aimer Marchington is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate, Yorkshire, England.

MARCOUX, JOSEPH JACQUES GERARD LAC R207375 – photography. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Oct 6/44 age 21. #127 Wing Headquarters. LAC Marcoux was killed while on duty by an enemy anti-personnel bomb. Leading AirCraftman Marcoux is buried in the Groesbeek Canadian War Cemetery, Nijmegen, Holland.

MARCUS, JOHN JOSEPH F/L(WAG) J9287. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed Dec 28/43 age 32. #60 Operational Training Unit. Mosquito aircraft #HX 861 crashed at Saint Denis, Gloucestershire, England. The pilot, not Canadian, was also killed. Flight Lieutenant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marcus is buried in the Haycombe Cemetery, Bath, Englishcombe, Somerset, England.

MARDER, MOIE F/O(BA) J27285. From Trail, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jan 30/44. #101 Squadron (Mens Agitat Molem). Lancaster aircraft #DV 303 was shot down near Alexanderhof, Teltow, Germany during a night attack against Berlin, Germany. Three RAF crew members were also killed. Three RAF members of the crew were taken Prisoners of War. Flying Officer Bomb Aimer Marder was buried at Alexanderhof, exhumed, and reburied in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MAREAN, FRED ATEN FS(P) R107744. From Estlin, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Mar 12/43 age 23. #78 Squadron (Nemo Non Paratus). Target – Essen, Germany. The crew of Halifax aircraft #DT 774 were on their way to the target when they were shot down by an enemy night fighter aircraft. The aircraft crashed near a farmhouse at Grafwegen, Germany. Six of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. A special memorial plaque was put up near the crash site in 1977. Flight Sergeant Pilot Marean is buried in the War Cemetery, Uden, Holland.

MARGISON, DOUGLAS MILLEN F/O(N) J25210. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action May 6/44 age 21. #37 Squadron (Wise Without Eyes). Wellington aircraft #HZ 814 failed to return from operations against Campina, Rumania. FS R.M. Cairns and P/O P.D. Parkes (RAF) were also killed. Flying Officer Navigator Margison has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MARGOLIS, ALBERT ABRAHAM FS(N) R60404. From Calgary, Alberta. Killed in Action Jul 9/42. #62 Squadron (Insperato). FS Margolis was killed when his Hudson aircraft #AE 523 was shot down at Akyab, India. Flight Sergeant Navigator Margolis has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MARGRETT, ALAN ARTHUR FS(N) R83550. From Montclair, New Jersey, U.S.A. Killed in Action Jun 10/42 age 20. #107 Squadron (Nous Y Serons). Boston aircraft #Z 2283 failed to return from ops., presumed enemy action. P/O L.D. Bowman was also killed and two RAF members of the crew missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Navigator Margrett has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARK, ALFRED ROTHWELL F/O(BA) J25770. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action Feb 25/44 age 25. #460 Australia Squadron (Strike And Return). Target – Schweinfurt, Germany. Please see P/O L.L. De Celles for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Bomb Aimer Mark was interred in the Schweinfurt Cemetery, exhumed, and reburied in the War Cemetery at Durnbach, Germany.

MARK, CLARENCE ROBERT IRWIN WO2(WAG) R190707. From Cameron, Ontario. Killed in Action Apr 25/45 age 21. #431 Iroquois Squadron (The Hatiten Ronteriios). Target – Wangerooge, Germany. Please see Stingle R.J. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mark has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARK, EDWARD FS(WAG) R99990. From Stratford, Ontario. Killed Jan 27/43 age 23. #31 Operational Training Unit, Debert, Nova Scotia. The crew of Hudson aircraft #AM 890 were returning from a navigation exercise and were approaching to land when the aircraft swung through 180° to the left and spun into the ground two miles south-west of aerodrome at Debert. Sgt H.R. Leadley, P/Os D.M. Bennett (RAF), and the pilot P/O E.J. Nash (RAF) were also killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Mark is buried in the Avondale Cemetery at Stratford, Ontario.

MARKLE, GEORGE HUDSON F/O(P) J17944. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Oct 19/43 age 21. #236 Squadron (Spectulati Nuntiate). Beaufighter aircraft #LZ 316 went down in the sea during operations against enemy shipping near the Dutch Coast. The RAF navigator was also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Markle is buried in the General Cemetery, Bergen, Holland.

MARKLE, JACK WELLINGTON FS(P) R71494. From Shoal Lake, Manitoba. Killed in Action May 9/42 age 26. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Target – Warenmunde, Germany. Please see P/O J.S. Dafoe for casualty list and flight detail. This was FS Markle’s eleventh operation. Flight Sergeant Pilot Markle is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARKLE, ORWIN CLEMENS P/O(P) J91091//R114962. From Dauphin, Manitoba. Killed Mar 7/44 age 24. #1 0.A.D.U. Beaufort aircraft #ML 444 missing in transit from Portreath, England to the Middle East. Three of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Markle has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARKOWSKI, JOSEPH RENE PHILIPPE F/O(P) J18061. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed May 27/44 age 24. #39 Squadron (Die Noctuque). The crew of Beaufighter aircraft #LZ 484 were engaged in a training flight when their aircraft crashed four miles west of Alghe, Sardinia. Flying Officer Pilot Markowski is buried in the San Michele Communal Cemetery, Cagliari, Sardinia, Italy.

MARKS, EDWARD MICHAEL P/O(WAG) J15139. From Oshawa, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 7/42. #214 Federated Malay States Squadron (Ultor In Umbris). Stirling aircraft lost. Please see P/O B.P. Cardinal for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marks has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARKS, EDWARD REGINALD WO2(AG) R134206. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Aug 18/43. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Target – Peenemunde, Germany. Please see Sheridan J.F. for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Air Gunner Marks is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARKS, GEORGE HENRY HERBERT WO2(N) R56238. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jun 3/42 age 21. #102 Ceylon Squadron (Tentate Et Perficite). Halifax aircraft #R 9491 lost in the sea off Ipswich, England, presumed enemy action. WO F.A. Holmes was also killed. Four RAF members of the crew missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Navigator Marks has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARKS, MORRIS FS(AG) R153059. From Oshawa, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 22/44 age 25. #630 Squadron (Nocturna Mors). Lancaster aircraft #JB 294 missing from a night trip to Berlin, Germany. Six members of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Marks is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARKS, WALTER DOUGLAS F/O(N) J12984. From Guelph, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 29/43 age 22. #420 Snowy Owl Squadron (Pugnamus Finitum). Wellington aircraft #DF 615 failed to return from night operations, presumed enemy action. Sgt J.C. Desrosiers was also killed. Flying Officer Navigator Marks has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARKS, WILLIAM KENNETH R.O. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed Aug 10/41. RAF Ferry Command. Hudson aircraft crashed. Please see McIntosh H.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Radio Officer Marks is buried in the Kilbride Old Churchyard, Lamlash, Buteshire, Isle of Arran, Scotland.

MARLATT, SAMUEL PAUL F/L(N) J7797. From Lytton, British Columbia. Killed in Action Nov 12/43 age 27. #418 City of Edmonton Squadron. Mosquito aircraft #HJ 829 missing during an intruder ‘sortie to Bretigny and Melun via Biville, France. P/O B.G. Henderson was also killed. Flight Lieutenant Navigator Marlatt was buried at Depeure, France, exhumed, and reburied in the Communal Cemetery at Evreux, are, France.

MARLATT, SHOLTO PATON F/O(P) J5971. From Powell River, British Columbia. Killed Nov 29/42 age 29. #4 Squadron (In Futurum Videre). F/O Marlaft was killed when he flew his Mustang aircraft into a hillside, in bad visibility, at Dunsop Bridge, England. Flying Officer Pilot Marlatt is buried in St. Anne’s Park Cemetery, Lytham, Lancashire, England.

MARLER, DONALD THOMAS FS(P) R105553. From Edmonton, Alberta. Killed in Action Nov 10/42 age 23. #102 Ceylon Squadron (Tentate Et Perficite). Halifax aircraft missing. Please see Zealand J.H. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Pilot,Marler is buried in the General Cernetery, Den Burg, Texel Island, Holland.

MARLER, NORMAN GORDON P/O(WAG) J95392//R184665. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Nov 9/44 age 22. #625 Squadron (We Avenge). Lancaster aircraft #NG 239 was shot down by flak at HertenScherlebeck, two miles north of Gelsenkirchen, Germany during an attack on Wanne-Eickel, Germany. F/Os A. Bruce, El. Brown, L.L. Guthrie, P/Os E.D. Wilmont, V.D. Campbell, and one RAF member of the crew were also killed. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marler was buried in a field near the crash, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MARLOWE, LEE KHAIM LAC(N) R145435 – under training. From Venice, California, U.S.A. Killed May 8/43 age 22. #10 Air Observers School, Chatham, New Brunswick. The crew of Anson aircraft #6689 were on a routine navigation flight and were unable to reach base due to unfavourable weather. The pilot made a forced landing in a river near Bathurst, New Brunswick. LAC Marlowe was the only casualty. Leading AirCraftman Navigator Marlowe is buried in the Hebrew Memorial Cemetery, Detroit, Michigan, U.S.A.

MAROK, JOSEPH MITCHELL P/O(P) J6801. From Detroit, Michigan, U.S.A. Killed Jan 26/42. #14 Operational Training Unit (Keep With The Pack). Hampden aircraft #P 1186 crashed one half mile north of the Pinchbeck Railway Station at Spalding, England: P/Os W.H. Lynch (RAAF), S.S. White (RAAF), and Sgt E. O’Connell (RAAF) were also killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Marok is buried in the St. Nicholas Churchyard Extension, Cottesmore, Rutland, England.

MARONEY, PAUL JAMES FS(AG) R131262. From Angola, New York, U.S.A. Killed in Action Nov 8/42. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus). Target – the harbour at La Gironde, France. Please see Hodgins A.K. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Maroney has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARR, GEORGE FREDERICK FS(AG) 140401. From Calgary, Alberta. Killed in Action Oct 22/41 age 22. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus). Target – Le Havre, France. Please see Hall C.R. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Marr has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARR, RONALD DOUGLAS CPL R99167 – armourer. From Ketepec, St. John County, New Brunswick. Killed Oct 20/43 age 22. #410 North Atlantic Squadron. Liberator aircraft crashed. Please see MacNaughton W.G. for complete casualty list and flight detail. Corporal Marr is buried in an isolated grave on Black Mountain, near St. Donat, Quebec.

MARR, STANLEY ALEX SGT(P) 974024 – Royal Air Force. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 5/42 age 22. #156 Squadron (We Light The Way). Wellington aircraft lost over enemy territory. Five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Sergeant Pilot Marr is buried in the Bergen General Cemetery, Holland.

MARRIOTT, JOHN ROBERT P/O(N) J17600//R96309. From Ottawa, Ontario. Killed in Action Apr 27/43. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus), Pathfinder Force. Target – Duisburg, Germany. Please see Sleeth S. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Navigator Marriott was buried in the North Cemetery at Dusseldorf, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Reichswald Forest War Cemetery, Kleve, Germany.

MARRIOTT, TERENCE JAMES F/O(P) J8641. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Mar 23/43 age 24. #511 Squadron.
