Liberator aircraft #AL 587 failed to complete a flight from Gibraltar to Lyneham, England. FS C.E. Ferro, F/Os J.S. Renouf, O.A. Smith, five crew members and eleven passengers, not Canadians, were also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Marriott has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSDEN, ARTHUR FRANK P/O(WAG) J87821//R104880. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jul 29/44 age 25. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Target – Hamburg, Germany. Please see P/O J.H. McCaffrey D.F.C. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marsden has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSDEN, RAYMOND WO2(WAG) R76565. From Hightown, Liversedge, Yorkshire, England. Killed in Action Jan 7/43 age 23. #614 County of Glamorgan Squadron (Coda I Geisio). Blenheim aircraft #BA 731 failed to return from operations. Two of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marsden has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Alamein War Memorial, Egypt.

MARSH, ALFRED JAMES F/O C8109 – aero engine mechanic. From Dauphin, Manitoba. Killed Aug 16/42 age 26. Ferry Training Unit, Defford, England. Anson aircraft #DJ 184 suffered structural failure and crashed four miles east of Cirencester. Five RAF airmen were also killed. Flying Officer Marsh is buried in the Cirencester Cemetery, Gloucestershire, England.

MARSH, CARL FINNEY SGT(P) R54825. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Jan 25/42 age 22. #232 Squadron (Strike). Hurricane aircraft #BE 641 failed to return from operations. Sergeant Pilot Marsh has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MARSH, FRANCIS JOSEPH FS(AG) R266317. From Westree, Ontario. Killed in Action Mar 15/45. #405 City of Vancouver Squadron (Ducimus), Pathfinder Force. Target – Misburg, Germany. Please see F/L L.N. Laing M.i.D. for casualty list and flight detail. FS Marsh was captured in the vicinity of the crash and was shot by the Gestapo. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Marsh was buried at Claustahl/Zellerfield, Germany, exhumed, and reburied in the Limmer British Cemetery at Hanover, Germany.

MARSH, FRANCIS PETER F/L(WAG) J15643 D.F.C. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Aug 18/43 age 23. #426 Thunderbird Squadron (On Wings of Fire). Lancaster aircraft #DS 681 was shot down by a German night fighter aircraft during night operations against Peenemunde, Germany. P/Os T. Dos Santos, H.M. Smith, and three RAF members of the crew were also killed. One RAF crew member was taken Prisoner of War. F/L Marsh had completed over 30 trips and had begun his second tour when he was killed. Flight Lieutenant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marsh is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARSH, REGINALD THOMAS WHITE FS(P) R168243. From Guelph, Ontario. Killed in Action Aug 9/44 age 23. #142 Squadron (Determination). Wellington aircraft #LN 857 missing during an attack on the American Oil Refineries at Ploesti, Rumania. Four members of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Pilot Marsh is buried in the Snagov British Military Cemetery, Bucharest, Rumania.

MARSHALL, DONALD COURTENAY WO2(P) R92466, From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jan 9/43 age 23. #12 Squadron (Leads The Field). Lancaster aircraft #W 4371 missing, presumed over target, presumed enemy action. WOs J.A. Buick and J.E. Bradley were also killed. Four of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Pilot Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSHALL, DOUGLAS CROSBIE FS(WAG) R57837. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Aug 20/41 age 20. #104 Squadron (Strike Hard). Wellington aircraft #W 5416 failed to return from bombing operations, presumed enemy action. Four of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSHALL, FRANCIS ARTHUR P/O(P) J95597//R181272. From White Rock, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jun 27/45 age 23. #240 Squadron. Catalina aircraft #JX 334 lost off Andaman Island, Bay of Fingal. Pilot Officer Pilot Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Singapore War Memorial, Malaya.

MARSHALL, GEORGE CHARLES P/O(P) J37336//R98536. From St. Walburg, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Oct 26/43 age 21. #149 Bomber Reconnaissance (Sea Wolf) Squadron, Annette Island, Alaska. Ventura aircraft crashed. Please see F/O A.J. Chandler A.F.M. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Pilot Marshall is buried in the Regina Cemetery at Regina, Saskatchewan.

MARSHALL, HUDSON ERIC FS(OB) R60897. From Daysland, Alberta. Killed in Action Nov 28/41 age 31. #408 Goose Squadron (For Freedom). Hampden aircraft #AE 437 went down in the sea 325 miles south-west of Lands End, England during a bombing operation, enemy action. F/O J.A. Caldwell (RAF), Sgts R. Crawley (RAF), and E.A. Harry (RAF) were also killed. Flight Sergeant Observer Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSHALL, JAMES STANLEY WO2(AG) R86762. From Edson, Alberta. Killed in Action Apr 21/43 age 21. #7 Squadron (Per Diem Per Noctum), Pathfinder Force. Target – Stettin, Germany. Please see FS L.J. Krulicki for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Air Gunner Marshall was buried at Drosselbjerg Denmark, exhumed, and reburied in the Commonwealth Memorial Cemetery, thirteen miles north-west of Svino, Denmark.

MARSHALL, JOHN GLENFORD ALEXANDER FS(BA) R129522. From London, Ontario. Killed in Action May 30/43 age 20. #428 Ghost Squadron (Usque Ad Finem). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Sgt H. MacMillan for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Bomb Aimer Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARSHALL, LAWRENCE P/O(P) J88713//R128251. From Luseland, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Mar,24/44 age 22. #76 Squadron (Resolute). Halifax aircraft #LK 790 missing during night operations over Berlin, Germany. P/O T.E. Wilkinson was also killed and five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Pilot Officer Pilot Marshall is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARSHALL, NORMAN P/O(P) J85166. From London, Ontario. Killed in Action Jun 7/44 age 27. #401 Ram Squadron (Mors Celerrima Hostibus). P/O Marshall was flying Spitfire aircraft #MK 902 on a patrol over the Eastern Beach just inland from the coast of Northern France and was last seen travelling at a high speed at zero feet over light flak. Pilot Officer Pilot Marshall is buried in the War Cemetery at Banneville-la-Campagne, Normandy, France.

MARSHALL, THOMAS P/O(P) C12590. From Glace Bay, Nova Scotia. Killed Dec 27/42 age 24. #1 Flying Instructor School, Trenton, Ontario. Harvard aircraft crashed. Please see Lee F.J. for flight detail. Pilot Officer Pilot Marshall is buried in the Hebrew Cemetery, Passchendaele, Nova Scotia.

MARSHALL, WALTER FARQUHAR WO2(N) R138078. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Dec 20/43 age 28. #434 Bluenose Squadron (In Excelsis Vincimus). Target – Frankfurt, Germany. Please see FS Sydney S. Smith for casualty list and flight detail. Warrant Officer Class II Navigator Marshall is buried in the Westduin General Cemetery, The Hague, South Holland, Holland.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM SGT(AG) R92517. From Calgary, Alberta. Killed Jul,4/44 age 29. #24 Operational Training Unit (Cum Labore Adjuvantes). Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see P/O W.A. Tees for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Marshall is buried in the Brookwood Military Cemetery, Woking, Surrey, England.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM CHARLES SGT(P) 920238 – Royal Air Force. From Regina, Saskatchewan. Killed in Action Dec 20/41 age 27. #18 Squadron (Anima Et Fide). Blenheim aircraft failed to return from operations. Sgts J.F. Billett (RAF) and 0.C. Summers (RAF) were also killed. Sergeant Pilot Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM JAMES SGT R97947 – radar mechanic. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Nov 7/44 age 21. #1 BSU. Transport ship sank at Ostende, Belgium. Please see Taylor D.D.M. for casualty list and detail. Sergeant Marshall is buried in the New Communal Cemetery, Ostende, West Flander, Belgium.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM JOHN F/O(P) J10778. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed Jul 30/43 age 21. #3502 Conversion Unit, RAF Station, Gosport, England. Hudson aircraft #FH 253 was on final approach when it crashed one mile south-west of the aerodrome at St. Athan, Wales. F/O L. Anderson was also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Marshall is buried in the Major Cemetery, Llantwit, Glanriorganshire, Wales.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM JOHN FS(OB) R75097. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Apr 13/42 age 22. #49 Squadron (Cave Canem). Hampden aircraft #AT 196 ran out of fuel and crashed at Chamberlain Charity Farm, Fitling Aldborough, Scotland. Two RAF members of the crew were also killed. Flight Sergeant Observer Marshall is buried in the Camelon or Falkirk Cemetery, Stirlingshire, Scotland.

MARSHALL, WILLIAM KENNETH F/O(P) J23396. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Nov 10/44 age 21. #518 Squadron. Halifax aircraft #LK 706 disappeared in the ocean 200 miles from land whilst on a meteorological flight over the North Atlantic. Six of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Flying Officer Pilot Marshall has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARTEL, JOSEPH ALPHONSE LEON WO2(BA) R159991. From Drummondville, Quebec. Killed in Action Jan 29144. #576 Squadron (Carpe Diem). Lancaster aircraft #ND 386 missing from a night trip to Berlin, Germany, presumed over the target. One Canadian, FS Grant, was either an Evader or was taken Prisoner of War. Five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Warrant Officer Class II Bomb Aimer Martel is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARTEL, PIERRE AUGUSTIN GUY P/O(OB) J16503//R77093. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed in Action Dec 20/42 age 21. #425 Alouette Squadron (Je Te Plumerai). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see Raymond J.P. for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Observer Martel was buried at Eindhoven, Holland, exhumed, and reinterred in the Canadian Cemetery, Nijmegen, Holland.

MARTELL, CHARLES ERNEST LAC R104349 – driver. From Cape Breton, Nova Scotia. Died Aug 6/43 age 25. RAF Station, Ford, England. LAC Martell died of natural causes while in the Boscombe Isolation Hospital, England. Leading AirCraftman Martell is buried in the North Cemetery at Bournemouth, Hampshire, England. Addendum: – LAC Martell was from Main-A-Dieu, Cape Breton, Nova Scotia. Detail provided by D.A. Stallard, Trenton, Nova Scotia.

MARTELLO, ROBERT JOSEPH F/O(P) J26660. From Rossland, British Columbia. Killed Jul 13/45 age 31. #11 Bomber Reconnaissance Squadron, Patricia Bay, British Columbia. Liberator aircraft crashed. Please see Mann M. for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Martello is buried in an isolated grave on the south-west shore of Barkely Sound, fifteen miles south-east of Bamfield, British Columbia. His name is also inscribed on the Ottawa War Memorial, Ottawa, Ontario.

MARTENS, ARTHUR TEMPEST F/L(P) 121948 – Royal Air Force. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 27/44 age 28. #426 Thunderbird Squadron (On Wings of Fire). Target – Berlin, Germany. Please see Brooks A. for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Martens is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARTENS, CONRAD WILLIAM P/O(AG) J90764//R198883. From Provost, Alberta. Killed in Action Jul 29/44. #100 Squadron (Sarang Tebaun Jangan Doulok). Target – Stuttgart, Germany. Please see F/O Wilfred J. Smith for casualty list and flight detail. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Martens is buried in the War Cemetery at Durnbach, Germany.

MARTIN, ALAN LAC 629898 – Royal Air Force. From Victoria, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jul 5/41 age 22. Lost at sea when the S.S. Anse1m sank. Leading AirCraftman Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARTIN, ALLISTAIR BRUCE FS(WAG) 1172512. From New Wiltshire, Prince Edward Island. Killed in Action Aug 1/42 age 24. #9 Squadron (Per Noctem Volamus). Wellington aircraft missing. Please see P/O W.V. Clarke for casualty list and flight detail. Flight Sergeant Wireless Operator Air Gunner Martin is buried in the War Cemetery, Heverlee, Brabant, Belgium.

MARTIN, ALVA JAMES P/O(NB) J87018. From Calgary, Alberta. Killed in Action Sep 12/44 age 23. #114 Hong Kong Squadron (With Speed I Strike). Boston aircraft #BZ 499 exploded in mid-air two miles southwest of the target Rimini, Italy. Two of the crew, not Canadians, were also killed. Pilot Officer Navigator/Bomb Aimer Martin was buried at the scene of the crash, exhumed, and reburied in the Coriano Ridge War Cemetery, Forli, Italy.

MARTIN, ARTHUR FREDERICK SGT(P) R97115, From Bellevile, Ontario. Killed in Action Oct 27/42 age 22. #112 Squadron (Swift In Destruction). Kittyhawk aircraft failed to return from operations. Sergeant Pilot Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Alamein War Memorial, Egypt.

MARTIN, ARTHUR NORMAN W/C(P) C782. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jan 22/44 age 28. #424 Tiger Squadron (Casitgandos Castigamus). Target – Magdeburg, Germany. Please see S/L D.M. Arnot D.F.C. for casualty list. W/C. Martin was the Commanding Officer of #424 Squadron at the time of his death. Rather than take his own crew out on his first trip he went over to #427 Sqdn. to fly as second Dickie (pilot) to gain experience. W/C. Martin’s crew had already completed half of their tour when he took over as C.O. Wing Commander Pilot Martin is buried in the Berlin War Cemetery, Charlottenburg, Germany.

MARTIN, BERNHARD WILLIAM F/O(P) J88129. From Golden Prairie, Saskatchewan. Killed I Action Feb 3/45 age 21. #419 Moose Squadron (Moosa Aswayita). Target – Wiesbaden, Germany. Please see F/O R.W. Hodgson for casualty list and flight detail. Flying Officer Pilot Martin was buried near the crash site, exhumed, and reburied in the War Cemetery at Rheinberg, Germany.

MARTIN, BURNETT HAMILTON FS(P) R80218. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Jul 3/42 age 20. #37 Squadron (Wise Without Eyes). The crew of a Wellington aircraft attacked a dump from 4,000 feet and the debris from the resulting explosion put a hole in the starboard engine. The engine caught fire and the crew abandoned the aircraft at 3,000 feet. One RAF crew member was also killed. FS Martin had been seriously injured on January 3, 1942 when a #22 O.T.U. Wellington aircraft crashed at Wellesbourne, Mountford, Warwick, England. He was in error reported killed in this crash. Flight Sergeant Pilot Martin is buried in the El Alamein War Cemetery, Egypt.

MARTIN, CHESTER THOMAS SGT(P) 1176682. From Blackfalds, Alberta. Died Jan 5/42 age 22. #22 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft #X 9640 crashed on January 3, 1943 at Wellesbourne Mountford, Warwick, England. FS H.A. McLennan was killed in the crash and Sgt Martin died of his injuries two days later. This was the crash in which FS B.M. Martin was erroneously reported killed. Sergeant Pilot Martin is buried in the Stratford-On-Avon Cemetery, Evesham Road, Warwickshire, England.

MARTIN, CLIFFORD MACKENZIE SGT(P) R64471. From Preston, Lancashire, England. Killed in Action Jul 9/41 age 27. #78 Squadron (Nemo Non Paratus). Whitley aircraft #Z 6555 failed to return from bombing operations. Five of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Sergeant Pilot Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARTIN, DANIEL MONTGOMERY SGT(AG) 11199556. From Montreal, Quebec. Killed Aug 7/43 age 19. #22 Operational Training Unit. Wellington aircraft crashed. Please see Hetherington P.M. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Martin is buried in the Stratford-On-Avon Cemetery, Evesham Road, Warwickshire, England.

MARTIN, EMERSON HUBERT FS(OB) 1162763. From Bury, Quebec. Killed in Action Apr 22/42 age 21. #106 Squadron (Pro Libertate). Wellington aircraft lost in the Bay of Biscay enroute to Malta from the United Kingdom. FSs E.F. Bramley, A.W. King, and three RAF members of the crew were also killed. Flight Sergeant Observer Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARTIN, ERIC F/O(WAG) J11121. From Vancouver, British Columbia. Killed Nov 29/42 age 21. #1446 Ferry Training Flight. Wellington aircraft stalled at an altitude of 40 feet and crashed at Moreton-inMarsh. F/O D.Y. McIntosh, Sgt C.R. Kippen (RAF), and one RAAF airman were also killed. This aircrew was attached to #44 Group for ferrying duties. Flying Officer Wireless Operator Air Gunner Martin is buried in the New Cemetery, Moreton-in-Marsh, Gloucestershire, England.

MARTIN, ERNEST WILLIAM F/L(P) J12780//R115216. From Toronto, Ontario. Killed Mar 10/45. #441 Silver Fox Squadron (Stalk And Kill). F/L Martin was engaged in practice interception in Spitfire aircraft #MK 216 and the last radio contact with him was when he was three miles south of Ronaldsay, Orkney, Scotland. Flight Lieutenant Pilot Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England.

MARTIN, FRED SCOTT WO1(WAG) R121334. From Oyer), Alberta. Killed in Action Sep 24/44 age 24. #293 Squadron. Warwick aircraft #BV 446 failed to return from an air-sea search forty miles west of Ponza Island, Italy. P/O R.J. DeImage, Sgt T.P. Lonsdale (RAF), P/O P.J. Purcell (RAF), and WO T.J.M.J. Peacock (RAF) were also killed. Warrant Officer Class I Wireless Operator Air Gunner Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Malta War Memorial, Malta.

MARTIN, GEORGE SGT(AG) R163413. From Spanish, Ontario. Killed in Action Jan 31/44 age 21, #1664 Heavy Conversion Unit. Halifax aircraft crashed. Please see Rahn R.H. for casualty list and flight detail. Sergeant Air Gunner Martin is buried in the Stonefall Cemetery, Wetherby Road, Harrogate, Yorkshire, England.

MARTIN, GEORGE BERNARD P/O(AG) J90929//R204939. From Squamish, British Columbia. Killed in Action Jul 26/44 age 21, #432 Leaside Squadron (Saevitir Ad Lucern). Halifax aircraft #NP 688 crashed eight miles south-east of Dijon at Breteniere, France during a night trip to Stuttgart, Germany. F/L D.W. Johnson, F/Os K.L. Moss, F. Wittmack, P/O J.R. Giles, and Sgt F.D. Crawford (RAF) were also killed. One Canadian, F/O Ellis, was taken Prisoner of War. Pilot Officer Air Gunner Martin is buried in the Breteniere Churchyard Cemetery, Cote D’or, France.

MARTIN, HAROLD RAYMOND SGT(AG) 904437 – Royal Air Force. From Winnipeg, Manitoba. Killed in Action Apr 8/41 age 20. #102 Ceylon Squadron (Tentate Et Perficite). Blenheim aircraft failed to return from operations. Two of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Sergeant Air Gunner Martin has no known grave, his name is inscribed on the Runnymede War Memorial, Englefield Green, Egham, Surrey, England,

MARTIN, HAROLD STUART FS(AG) R173738. From Hamilton, Ontario. Killed in Action Aug 12/43 age 19. #76 Squadron (Resolute). Halifax aircraft #DK 240 took off from Holme on Spalding Moor, England, and went missing over enemy territory, cause unknown. FS L.F. Jackson (RAF), Sgts J.R. Luxton (RAF), A.C. Samuel (RAF), and P/O B.S. McCann (RAF) were also killed. Two others of the crew, not Canadians, missing believed killed. Flight Sergeant Air Gunner Martin is buried in the Ste. Croix Communal Cemetery, Bernay
